Company code is the central organizational unit of external accounting within SAP.  A company code is set up for each of Under Armourâ€™s legal entities that allows for stand-alone legal entity statutory reporting and consolidated U.S. GAAP reporting when grouping / consolidating company codes together for SEC (Securities & Exchange Commission) reporting.  A company code is the smallest organization unit of accounting for which a complete, self-contained set of accounts will be created.  All business transactions are entered, saved and evaluated at the company code level that allows for the creation of legal entity financial statements (balance sheets and profit & loss statements).

Common practice is one company code equates to one legal entity.  Every company code that will be set up in SAP falls into one of three categories;  Full - Company code will be fully operational within all FMS modules (MM, SD, etc.),  TB - Company code will be a trial balance upload from B1 entities,  FICO - Company code will not be fully functional but allows for certain financial transactions such as manual journal entries, accounts payable and accounts receivable sub-ledger and payroll integration..

See attached for list of valid company codes.
Format;  4 digit numeric
North America = 1000-1999
Europe = 2000-2999
Latin America = 3000-3999
Asia Pacific = 4000-4999
Sourcing / Holding = 9000-9999
